file_content.text: We've started the cleanup. Soon there won't be any trace of those bugs. I can't thank you enough.
You did it! The Colicoids have pulled back.
We could tell the moment the queen died; the fight just went right out of them.
I'm just glad I was able to help.
Good to hear it.
We wouldn't have made it without you. With the bugs taken care of, I think we'll finally be okay.
Sounded like morale was pretty bad before. What's it like now?
How are your people doing?
Better. We're packing up and switching gears--we've got an Empire to fight.
There aren't enough languages in the galaxy to say thank you.
Don't call on me again.
Don't worry. We can take care of ourselves from here on out. Thanks for everything.
Two more people were attacked this morning. You've got to do something about those bugs!
I didn't expect them to send a Jedi our way. I won't complain, though; the Colicoids are tearing us apart.
Captain, I'm sure glad to see you. The Colicoids are tearing us apart.
Over here! I was expecting soldiers, but I guess the Colicoids are tearing up comms, too.
It's about time Command sent someone down here. The Colicoids are tearing us apart.
You think, "they're just big bugs," but they're smart. Perfect, living weapons--I've never faced anything like them.
I called for reinforcements after they grabbed Captain Langstrom. I'm just glad you finally made it through.
Start at the beginning. What are you talking about?
What's going on, Sergeant?
The Colicoids were designed to kill everything that moves. It's all they do--kill and eat. Morale's in tatters.
Where's your commanding officer, Sergeant?
Who's in charge here?
I guess that's me. After the Colicoids got Cap-- I've tried to hold what's left of the unit together, but morale's in shambles.
Tosh shot himself in the foot rather than face them again. I've got more deserters than actives, now.
I'm not your reinforcements.
Yeah? Well... you're here now. Please, you've got to help us.
I'd like to get my hands on the scientists who created these things. Danstrom wasn't even dead yet--the Colicoids pulled him down and started eating.
Still yourself. Fear lays a path best not traveled.
Calm down.
You need to keep calm, Sergeant. Your soldiers are counting on you.
Get ahold of yourself.
Your heart's going to pop if you don't relax a little.
Calm down, soldier.
I'll try. It's just--the attacks started so suddenly. No one was ready.
You said "created." Who would create something like that?
Tell me about the Colicoids.
The corporations, I heard. Each trying to make the best weapon. Each bug's a killing machine.
This matters to me how?
Giant bugs are eating innocent people! Surely that means something to you.
We thought they were bad in Bugtown. There must be another hive, though; there's more bugs than ever.
Please, you've got to find that hive and clear it out. We can't withstand another assault.
Can you spare any men to help?
Any chance of some backup?
I don't even have enough to protect the supply lines. I can't spare anyone else.
If you find the hive, you've got to hunt down and kill the queen, otherwise she'll just start all over.
Not my fight. [Refuse quest]
You won't be so flippant when the bugs start eating someone you care about.
I had a report of civilians gone missing. Keep your eyes peeled while you're out there.
How many soldiers can you spare?
Any chance of some backup?
Just tell me where the hive is, and I'll handle it.
Bugs? I'll take care of them.
We lost two full patrols in the caves near here. That could be where their hive is hidden.
I'm not afraid of the bugs.
